result.execSummary:
The defendant Zak A Mader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zak A Mader is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zak A Mader was found guilty of Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Zak A Mader was found guilty of 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: NO unauthorized contact with victims. No contact with anyone under the age 18.

Assessments/evaluations/programming deemed appropriate by agent.
15 years Sex Offender Registry.

AMENDED NCLUDES 14CF957, 14CF958.    No contact with victim(s):  A.R.D.; M.R.R.; M.J.R. - except incidental contact at school for all 3 people.  No unsupervised contact with anyone under age of 18.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Be on school property only to attend classes.  Live with your mother or father or R.A.  Be at school or at home unless with your parents. Defendant to log 3 hours of school work each day school is scheduled at Marathon Highschool.  Bond to be co-signed by your parent.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 4:13 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF957 AND 14CF958. 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person with Atty Suzanne O'Neill. 
Date and time set for hearing to address letter from R.A. regarding bond - requesting removal of her name. 
COURT questions if R.A. is present.
R.A. is NOT present - notice of today's hearing was sent to her. 
Atty O'Neill notes deft is now residing with his mother and not with R.A. 
State does not object to modifying bond and notes bond violations regarding school attendance. 
COURT will not address any bond violations today. 
COURT removes R.A. as co-signer on bond and directs all other conditions of bond to remain the same and deft's mother to remain as co-signer. 
COURT sets calendar call on 6/24/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA. 
Adj: 4:19 pm
Bail/bond hearing on June 15, 2015 at 04:10 pm.
